Irisbond Duo API
  • notitle
Testing

Introduction

The testing process is a calibration+testing process where the precision and accuracy of Irisbond Duo tracker can be measured. This functionality is mainly focused on internal use. However, we have released it to developers if anyone wants to try.

These are the steps you need to follow in order to do a successful test:

  1. In the IrisbondAPITest.exe program, you first need to check the Record Calibration checkbox.
  2. Calibrate with the desired points. The more points you use, the better the results you are expected to get.
  3. Click Start Test and do the 36 points calibration-like process.

After finishing this 3 steps, close the program and go to your root directory (C:\ or D:\ depending on where it is located the program). There should be a primmaBenchmark folder. All the tests you perform will be stored in folders with the date as the name. Inside those folders, pictures of the calibration process will be stored, and another subdirectory with the date as its name too. Inside this subdirectory, more pictures of the testing process and 3 images of the points recorded during testing can be found, called test_left.png, test_right.png and test_combined.png.

Finaly, in the .csv you can find the results of all test divided by columns that show what each of the values that have been measured is.

This functionality is not polished yet so expect it not to work perfectly always.
